subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] RoboBox schematic
author: Rhonda W
full_text:
--0-2136892459-1206388581=:76365
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

LOL! Hey I could fly that baby!  But I couldnt put together a box like Franks even if I had step by step directions lol...I can however program my VCR/DVD players lol.
   
  Wait I take that back....do you all remember those old RS radio kits you put together yourself..and had to hunker down under the kitchen sink with a wire attached to the copper hot water tube?  I did put one of those together when I was a kid hehe. Fun times that was...was so excited that it worked.
   
  Rhonda

bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
          Yeah okay Frank, you might as well say fly the space shuttle!!!!!!!!!
 
bruce


  Bruce Halliday 




    
---------------------------------
  To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com
From: purplealiengirl@...
Date: Mon, 24 Mar 2008 12:53:26 -0600
Subject: [EVP-ITC] RoboBox schematic

       So others can try this? Use the Speakjet data sheet to configure that chip. I just float the SJ's reset pin--not connecting it to anything, the idea being that entities can use that to control the chip because you can wave your hand over the reset pin and the chip will reset, announcing "Ready".
 
 Frank-S
